com.netheos.servlets

Class FAQServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.netheos.servlets.FAQServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class FAQServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Servlet processing all REST calls concerning the Frequently Asked Questions. It may be split into different classes/servlets if it becomes big enough, or on the contrary, merged with other features if they are small enough and/or close enough in behavior.
    There are 3 possible uses now :
    - Use case 1 (send a new couple question/answer (+tags) to add to the database) : Use POST with the question, answer and tags as parameters. Set also the request type to REQUEST_TYPE_ADD_NEW_FAQ. Tags are meant to be sent as letters-only Strings, separated by the tag separator (ex tag1;tag2). Admin use only, you must also send admin username/password
    - Use case 2 (retrieve all data from the FAQ) : Use GET. Set the request type to REQUEST_TYPE_GET_ALL_FAQ and the format to JSON_FORMAT. Admin use only, you must also send admin username/password
    - Use case 3 (get all FAQ whose question or answer contains a given pattern) : Use GET with the pattern to match as parameter. Set also the request type to REQUEST_TYPE_GET_CORRESPONDING_FAQ and the format to JSON_FORMAT.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • FAQ_TABLE_NAME

        public static final String FAQ_TABLE_NAME
        Name of the main table of this project. Although the implementation is technically a collection and not a table, DB matters (here, the fact that it's mongoDB) do not belong in the controller : it could be a table, if DatabaseAccessor used SQL for example. Therefore "table" is used as a general case.
